name: Leg Raises, Standing
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart in an area with enough space to move your legs freely.
2. You can place your hands on your hips for balance or extend them sideways. Alternatively, if balance is an issue, hold onto a wall, chair, or similar stable support.
3. Shift your weight slightly onto your left leg, keeping it straight.
4. Slowly lift your right leg out to the side as high as comfortably possible without tilting your torso. Your toes should point forward or slightly upward.
5. Hold the position briefly at the top of the movement, focusing on engaging your core and the muscles in your working leg.
6. Lower your right leg back to the starting position with control.
7. Repeat the motion for a set number of repetitions.
8. Switch legs and perform the same number of repetitions for your left leg.
9. Throughout the exercise, keep your core engaged and your back straight, avoiding leaning to either side.
short_summary: A bodyweight exercise performed while standing to target the hips and core by raising one leg to the side.
